description: Virtualization technology is key for everyone working professionally in the IT field. Familiarity with some of the most used Virtualization tools would be valuable to the IT professional. This show reviews basic virtualization technology common to all virtualization tools. Then it takes each of the mentioned tools and dives into getting it started.
name: Virtualization Technologies
subtitle: Fundamentals of Virtualization

episodes.description: Virtualization technology is key for everyone working professionally in the IT field. Familiarity with some of the most used Virtualization tools would be valuable to the IT professional. This show reviews basic virtualization technology common to all virtualization tools. Then it takes each of the mentioned tools and dives into getting it started.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:07.346
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:07.346 --> 00:00:08.390
Hello and welcome.

3
00:00:08.390 --> 00:00:12.120
We're here to introduce a new series,
Virtualization Technologies.

4
00:00:12.120 --> 00:00:14.600
And Ronnie,
what can we expect to see in this?

5
00:00:14.600 --> 00:00:17.980
>> When we start taking a look at
virtualization technologies, what we're

6
00:00:17.980 --> 00:00:22.040
gonna do of course is make sure that you
understand what the basics really are.

7
00:00:22.040 --> 00:00:26.218
We're gonna talk about some different
terminologies that you're gonna encounter.

8
00:00:26.218 --> 00:00:29.776
We're gonna actually make sure that
you understand why we actually use

9
00:00:29.776 --> 00:00:33.450
virtualization, as well as take a look
at just the basic concepts between

10
00:00:33.450 --> 00:00:37.088
the technologies, such as type one and
type two high providers as well.

11
00:00:37.088 --> 00:00:39.090
So, we're gonna introduce you that way.

12
00:00:39.090 --> 00:00:44.130
And then, you're gonna see in this series
that we're going to be walking you through

13

some of the most popular virtualization
technologies you are likely to see,

14
00:00:48.680 --> 00:00:50.573
such as Oracle's VirtualBox.

15
00:00:50.573 --> 00:00:54.999
We're gonna take you through,
of course, Microsoft's Hyper V,

16
00:00:54.999 --> 00:00:58.882
we're also gonna take a look
at VMwares Workstation 2, or

17
00:00:58.882 --> 00:01:03.795
Workstation 11 I should say, and
then of course VMwares ESX or VSphere.

18
00:01:03.795 --> 00:01:07.908
And lastly we're gonna take a look at
one that is a little bit more unusual,

19
00:01:07.908 --> 00:01:12.482
especially if you're just starting out
in virtualization, one called KVM Kernel

20
00:01:12.482 --> 00:01:16.590
based virtual machines,
that normally runs off of Linux as well.

21
00:01:16.590 --> 00:01:20.355
So we'll be taking a look at all those
different technologies for us, and

22
00:01:20.355 --> 00:01:21.701
introducing you to them.

23
00:01:21.701 --> 00:01:23.789
Well see, the idea here is fairly simple,

24
00:01:23.789 --> 00:01:26.577
we want you to actually feel
like that you can install it.

25
00:01:26.577 --> 00:01:29.337
We want you to be able to
create a virtual machine in it,

26
00:01:29.337 --> 00:01:32.250
as well as be able to manage
that virtual machine.

27
00:01:32.250 --> 00:01:36.300
Be able to do some of the basic things
that anybody in the IT industry

28
00:01:36.300 --> 00:01:39.490
would actually be able to say hey,
I can work with that technology.

29
00:01:39.490 --> 00:01:42.810
>> Ronnie, now speaking of maybe just
starting out in a virtualization

30
00:01:42.810 --> 00:01:46.090
technology, is this gonna be
something that's exam based,

31
00:01:46.090 --> 00:01:50.470
maybe targeted towards a certain exam or
certification?

32
00:01:50.470 --> 00:01:55.560
>> This particular set of shows that
we're gonna be doing are not really gonna

33
00:01:55.560 --> 00:02:00.360
be exam based, but they're more towards
helping you develop as an IT worker.

34
00:02:00.360 --> 00:02:04.090
The whole goal is simple, let's just
take for an example as a scenario,

35
00:02:04.090 --> 00:02:06.990
that you're getting hired for
a company and you wanna learn more about

36
00:02:06.990 --> 00:02:11.250
virtualization technology, because you're
gonna be expected to know about it.

37
00:02:11.250 --> 00:02:12.845
Well this series is perfect for you,

38
00:02:12.845 --> 00:02:15.930
since you will get an introduction
to the basic terminology.

39
00:02:15.930 --> 00:02:19.690
You will also end up seeing all of those
different technologies that we've just

40
00:02:19.690 --> 00:02:23.970
mentioned here, and show you how to
actually work in them a little bit, so

41
00:02:23.970 --> 00:02:28.660
that you can feel confident
that as you go into a job,

42
00:02:28.660 --> 00:02:32.110
to a production network somewhere,
that you're not gonna be completely lost.

43
00:02:32.110 --> 00:02:35.180
And you actually have seen some
of the very technical sides

44
00:02:35.180 --> 00:02:38.080
of the way that we install it,
as well as get a virtual machine up and

45
00:02:38.080 --> 00:02:41.810
running and even getting rid
of virtual machines as well.

46
00:02:41.810 --> 00:02:43.920
So this is actually a very good and

47
00:02:43.920 --> 00:02:47.355
very hands on type of series
you're gonna eventually see.

48
00:02:47.355 --> 00:02:51.360
>> Now, Ronnie, if somebody is getting
into virtualization technologies, and

49
00:02:51.360 --> 00:02:55.068
they're gonna be watching our series
on virtualization technologies,

50
00:02:55.068 --> 00:02:57.236
who is the targeted audience for this one?

51
00:02:57.236 --> 00:03:00.881
>> The targeted audience is really
the person that needs to understand more

52
00:03:00.881 --> 00:03:02.144
about virtualization.

53
00:03:02.144 --> 00:03:06.309
Whether you're just somebody that's saying
hey, I want to know about virtualization,

54
00:03:06.309 --> 00:03:10.200
or whether you're actually somebody that
is now working on staff at some production

55
00:03:10.200 --> 00:03:13.654
network and they're telling you you're
about to actually get introduced

56
00:03:13.654 --> 00:03:17.910
more to the virtualization technologies,
or they want you to learn more about it.

57
00:03:17.910 --> 00:03:22.630
Well here's where you will get a bit of a
dive into the different technologies, and

58
00:03:22.630 --> 00:03:26.490
regardless of what shop that you're
working in, you'll probably see one,

59
00:03:26.490 --> 00:03:31.250
if not more than one of these
technologies that we will be diving into.

60
00:03:31.250 --> 00:03:36.530
So if your goal of course is to become
a better IT worker in your skills,

61
00:03:36.530 --> 00:03:40.480
if your goal is hey, my job is going
to require it in the near future,

62
00:03:40.480 --> 00:03:44.670
I need to learn more about it, or
I'm just interested in the technology,

63
00:03:44.670 --> 00:03:47.630
it will range every where
in that different range.

64
00:03:47.630 --> 00:03:51.620
It doesn't get in to the most technical
aspects of every single virtualization

65
00:03:51.620 --> 00:03:56.200
technology, but a good well-rounded
approach to how you install it,

66
00:03:56.200 --> 00:03:58.120
how do you actually create a VM?

67
00:03:58.120 --> 00:04:01.120
Where do you actually get
the installation files from, and

68
00:04:01.120 --> 00:04:03.510
of course,
how do you get it up and running?

69
00:04:03.510 --> 00:04:06.246
And we'll actually show you all
of that in this new series.

70
00:04:06.246 --> 00:04:09.411
>> Great, and if that sounds something
like you might be interested in,

71
00:04:09.411 --> 00:04:10.915
virtualization technologies,

72
00:04:10.915 --> 00:04:13.986
stick around cuz we've got a lot
of great episodes coming your way.

73
00:04:13.986 --> 00:04:19.409
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike introduce the concepts of virtualization. They cover some of the basic terminology needed to understand virtualization. They explain important concepts such as hypervisors, VMs, and host and guest operating systems. They also talk about hardware assisted virtualization technologies, Intel VT and AMD-V.
episodes.title: Virtualization Concepts

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike talk about the benefits and limitations of virtualization. They explain how virtualization provides benefits through consolidation, containment, high optimization, and migration. They go over some of the limitations of virtualization, including administration and configuration challenges, as well as consolidation ratios. They also cover how virtualization can impact security considerations and practices.
episodes.title: Benefits and Limitations

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike discuss the different types of hypervisors available. They compare and contrast Type I and Type II hypervisors and give examples of each. They go over some hardware requirements, like 64-bit processors, virtualization extenstions, and BIOS support.
episodes.title: Getting Started

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike demonstrate installing VirtualBox, a Type II hypervisor. They verify system requirements and download the VirualBox installer files. Then the do a default install on Windows 10. Once installed, they create a basic virtual machine.
episodes.title: Installing Virtual Box

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes demonstrate VMWare Workstation. They discuss the requirements to get VMWare Workstation installed and running. They will talk about the resources needed for the host operating system as well as the requirements for guest virtual machines that run inside VMWare Workstation.
episodes.title: VMware Workstation

episodes.description: 3.2- In this episode Ronnie and Wes take a look at how to configure a virtual machine in VMWare Workstation. They talk about some of the pre-installation tasks like operating system installation media, applications to be installed and network configuration. They explore post-installation tasks like installing VMWare Workstation Tools, capturing a point-in-time snapshot of a virtual machine and cloning a virtual machine. They will demonstrate how to remove a virtual machine once the VM is no longer needed.
episodes.title: Configure a VMware VM

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes discuss some of the advanced configurations that can be achieved in VMWare Workstation.
episodes.title: Advanced VM Features

episodes.description: 3.4 In this episode Ronnie and Wes look at managing virtual machines inside of VMWare Workstation. They discuss how to manage the virtual disks that the virtual machines use through compaction and defragmentation. They demonstrate how to configure preferences once a virtual machine has been created and to share files through creating shared folders. They explore maintaining security for the virtual machine environment.
episodes.title: Manage VMware VMs

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes introducing Microsoft’s Hyper-V. They will look at the hardware requirements to get Hyper-V installed and running. They will discuss the requirements for the host operating system as well as the guest operating system. They demonstrate how to create a virtual machine using the Hyper-V Manager console inside of Windows Server 2012 R2.
episodes.title: Install Hyper-V

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike introduce Microsoft’s Hyper-V found in Windows Server 2012R2.   They discuss how the Hyper-V role installs as a Type I hypervisor.  Then Mike shows some of the different settings that we might want to consider customizing before creating a VM in Hyper-V.  Since most Type I Hypervisors are used in a production environment they mention that taking the time to make the customization is worth the time and effort to be more efficient later as we produce more VMs on Hyper-V.
episodes.title: Configuring Hyper-V

episodes.description: n this episode, Ronnie and Mike talk about the setting and configurations that we must consider when building a Hyper-V VM for production use.  They show how to configure resource settings during the creation and talk about some of settings that may need to be created separately then selected in the given wizard.  After walking through the wizard,  they create a VM with no OS installed and show virtualized machine that we can now follow a regular install of an operating system.
episodes.title: Configuring Hyper-V Part 2

episodes.description: 5.1-In this episode Ronnie and Wes take a look at VMWare ESXi also know today as VSphere. They discuss the requirements to get ESXi installed and where to find the information on those requirements. They talk about the host operation system requirements and demonstrate the installation process.
episodes.title: Install VMware ESXi

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes look at how to configure VMWare ESXi. They will show you how to connect to the ESXi server and install the client. They will explore the client interface and discuss the features available to the user. They demonstrate creating a VMWare ESXi virtual machine.
episodes.title: Configure VMware ESXi

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes take a look at how to manage VMWare ESXi virtual machines. They will go through how to install the guest operation system inside the virtual machine. They discuss the options available when configuring the data store where is installation media can be installed from. They explore how to monitor the performance of the virtual machines and resource allocation on the host machine. They explore the power down options for the virtual machines and the affect the virtual machine.
episodes.title: Manage VMs in ESXi

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes explore the Kernel-Based Virtual Machine or KVM. They demonstrate the hardware requirements for KVM and how to verify the system has the necessary requirements. They look at installing the correct packages needed to run KVM as well as verifying those packages are installed and present prior to using KVM.
episodes.title: Install KVM

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes continue their discussion on Kernel-based Virtual Machine or KVM. They look at how to set up network communication by creating a bridged network adapter. They show how to configure forwarding in IPTables for the KVM platform. They will also demonstrate how to use SELinux to implement mandatory access control for the directory that the virtual machines use.
episodes.title: Install KVM Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes look at how to create a virtual machine inside of Kernel-based Virtual Machine or KVM. They look at how to accomplish this task inside the graphical user interface(GUI) as well as how to create a virtual machine in a terminal session. They demonstrate how to start and stop virtual machines from the terminal. They explore how to set a virtual machine up for an autostart as well.
episodes.title: Create and Manage VMs

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes continue their discussion on creating and managing virtual machines inside of Kernel-based Virtual Machines or KVM. They look at how to clone a virtual machine as well as starting and stopping the cloned machines. They demonstrate how to create and restore virtual machine snapshots. They also explorer some of the various management commands in that can be used inside of KVM.
episodes.title: Create and Manage VMs Part 2
